poem:
**Gusty Mornings**

Beneath the vast  
gray blanket—  
a man's last breath  
mingles with the breeze.  

Silence now roots  
where life once clung.  

Branches sway,  
their whispers carry  
warnings—  
howling over the sea,  
each gust a reminder:  
fragile vessels  
in a world of winds.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK weather warnings remain in place as man killed by falling tree in Ireland named – as it happened 12.26pm GMT Closing summary New weather warnings have been released for the start of the week. In the east of England a yellow warning for “strong and gusty winds” is now in place between 6am on Monday until the same time on Tuesday. The Met Office said some coastal routes, sea fronts and coastal communities will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
